History: Patient had been facing issues of overthinking about not getting respected from others since teenage years. She has been jumping to the conclusion frequently.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior- Rapport could be established, patient was cooperative; Affect- anxious; Thought- Content: reflects overthinking
Psychotherapy Type: Type: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy; Mode: Individual
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient was extremely disturbed by one of her co-worker's behaviour. She had tried to talk about it and she came back at her which made her anxiety worse. Since teenage she has had a belief system that others don't respect her the way she deserves and jumps to this conclusion.
Reflections by the therapist: She is receptive of the therapy. She is able to understand this pattern and has been learning to apply the ABC framework and alternate actions she can take to break this pattern.
Action Plan: target irrational thoughts and use alternate ways to react in situations which were earlier triggering.
